page.title: 05Industry in Jedburgh
page.content: The biggest single employer in Jedburgh is Starrett,an American company,opened in 1959.Production started with bandsaws.Today it is one of the biggest suppliers of bandsaws in the world.It also makes hacksaw blades and precision tools.The products are exported to Japan and over 100 other countries.It employs over 300 people. The second main factory is Mainetti an Italian company producing plastic pipes and coat hangers.The plastic is supplied by Britain and Sweden.The pipes are for protecting underground cables and others for the middle of rolls of carpet. Mainetti,built in,1975,employs 175 people.
